arts.ttl: Birmingham City player ratings as Paik shines in convincing Bolton win
arts.sum: Tomoki Iwata and Jay Stansfield (pen) scored either side of half-time to ensure Blues got their just rewards for another dominant display. May had another big chance to score a few minutes into the second half after being put through by an excellent Christoph Klarer pass.

arts.ttl: Ian Evatt pays Birmingham City the ultimate compliment after Bolton were outclassed
arts.sum: Bolton were dominated by Chris Davies’ Blues but they did have an excellent chance to score before Stansfield’s game-clinching penalty. Bolton were among the clubs expected to challenge Blues for promotion at the start of the season but there is already an 11-point gap between the two teams.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies admits Tomoki Iwata surprise after Birmingham City down Bolton
arts.sum: Iwata was signed for his combative qualities but the Japanese midfielder has scored four goals in his first nine Blues outings. “We spoke before the game that they’re a good team at this level, one of the better teams.

arts.ttl: Leaders Birmingham march on with win over Bolton
Leonard starts, May moves, no Stansfield in our Birmingham City XI for Bolton
arts.sum: (4-2-3-1): Allsop; Laird, Klarer, Davies, Cochrane; Iwata, Leonard; Willumsson, May, Anderson; Dykes Davies expects his right-back to get through plenty of running and could give Taylor Gardner-Hickman a breather now that Laird is fit.

arts.ttl: Manager lands sixth job in four years since leaving Birmingham City
arts.sum: Former Birmingham City manager Pep Clotet has landed a new job as boss of Italian side Triestina. It was Clotet who blooded a 16-year-old Jude Bellingham in the Championship during his only season in charge.

arts.ttl: Bolton boss Ian Evatt refuses to play overused Birmingham City card
arts.sum: “It is a big test for everyone, me and the team,” Evatt told Bolton News. "They are an anomaly at this level, no two ways about it, and it hasn’t been seen at this level before but it’s one thing to do what they have done, it is another to start as consistently as they have done.

arts.ttl: How Bolton Wanderers could line up against Birmingham City
arts.sum: A look at how Wanderers could line up against Birmingham City at St Andrew's tonight
